meanings.definition: To make morally corrupt or wicked.
meanings.sent1: The villain was depraving the innocent minds with his evil ideas.
meanings.sent2: The criminal was depraving the youth with his bad influence.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat seemed to be depraving the other pets with its naughty behavior.
meanings.sent4: The dark clouds depraving the clear sky, symbolized the impending storm.
meanings.sent5: The eerie music in the horror movie was depraving the atmosphere, setting a sinister tone.

meanings.definition: To lead someone into a morally corrupt or wicked way of life.
meanings.sent1: The cult leader was depraving his followers, leading them astray.
meanings.sent2: The peer pressure was depraving the young students, pushing them towards unethical choices.
meanings.sent3: The persuasive salesman seemed to be depraving customers into buying unnecessary products.
meanings.sent4: The twisted path through the forest was depraving travelers into getting lost.
meanings.sent5: The hypnotic dance moves were depraving the audience, drawing them into a trance-like state.
